repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes #24452.

Leaving this here to see what people think; see commit messages for details.

Personally, not too sold on the hacks-on-top-of-hacks approach here. :smiling_face_with_tear:
(I still have a mild preference for leaving the restrictions alone)

I have an open PR in Vim for the `win_size_restore()` bug, but I dunno when it'll be reviewed.

comment_data.body: should `cmdwin_old_curwin` be "cleared" (set to NULL) after this?
It could be for safety, but it doesn't have to be (it should be valid if cmdwin_type != 0, which I added as a doc comment for it)

These special cases checking `win == cmdwin_old_curwin` in various places, are the only part that seems "hacky" to me.

But the rest of this PR seems to go in the right direction: make cmdwin less of a special-case.

One way to contain the spread-around hacks is to put them in a common shared function somehow.
If setting to NULL avoids accidents, seems worth it to me. I can't judge if that's the case though.
Haha, yeah the introduction of `cmdwin_old_curwin` is what made me start having second-thoughts. :sweat_smile:
It definitely doesn't hurt to add. :+1:
nit: helpful if this lives next to `can_close_floating_windows`, which is where other "close" related functionality also lives

comment_regular_data.body: It's mentioned in a lot of places that API errors shouldn't be translated
Ah, I wasn't aware of that. In that case, I'll change the existing `e_cmdwin` messages to be untranslated (seems there was a few).
Turns out messing with the last statusline could also cause `win_size_restore()` to change `&cmdheight`. This should also be addressed now...

repo.description: [Contribution Fork] Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(api): relax cmdwin restrictions for a few functions
